react.name: Portfolio
desc: THIS website was created using React, Vite, TypeScript, and TailwindCSS.
As a challenge, it makes use of as little a number of external packages and images.
Other than EmailJS & Custom Scrollbars, it makes the most out of pure React.
The code structure makes it very scalable, maximizing the maintainability of the project
while minimizing the number of files to be modified whenever changes occur.

react.name: Sungka Online
desc: BEING my first React project, I had to learn as  I code, and learn I did.
This application uses Typescript and Sockets.io to operate rooms and matches for Sungka.
Code for both the front (server) and back (client) ends can be found in the repostory.
Since this entire idea initially came from a chat app, I also added chat features, because why not?
Still, having been my very first attempt, there are still optimizations to be made;
improvements to the the file and CSS layouts are the first priorities if I ever choose to revisit this.

flutter.name: Dexy
desc: A PokeDex app made in Flutter/Dart, for Desktop and Mobile,based on an old college prototype
It accesses resources from PokeAPI, and stores most data via SQFLite.
As for the sprites, they are saved locally in the assets folder,
with some manual modifications to minimize file sizes.
This is still in development, with only the major features working.
Updates would implement more screens for displaying Pokemon data,
as well as allowing the user to access API & theme controls.
